page.title: 07O.S.Area 4142-3940
page.content: This area is mainly a mixture of farmland and woodland, with the A64 trunk road crossing the Northern Section. The woodland is deciduous. Most of the farmland consists of fields containing pasture for sheep and wheat. Woodlands Farm, in the extreme North West of the section, is 380 years old and is rented from the Bramham Park Estate. It is a mixed farm, with the crops of wheat, barley, oats and potatoes and the livestock is 50 cattle, 1 bull and 200 sheep. Whitewells Farm is in the extreme Northern Section and concentrates in keeping geese. It has two regular workers. In the extreme North East of the section there are some kennels which employ two people.
